review: Very pleased with Fire Stick. I have begun to watch a lot of streaming moviies during the cold winter days. Thanks.

review: Haven't exhausted all possibilities yet, but so far, it just loads and loads and loads.  Hoping it's just a weak wifi signal, though a solution to that won't be easy given router and TV respective locations.
author: Amazon Customer

review: Followed directions and was up and running in about 15 minutes. Works extremely well. Remote control a little small for my big hands but okay once you get used to it.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a quick installation for movies and apps.
author: Harry D. Weeks

review: Disconnected from network all the time.
author: daniel

review: The bad thing about it is that it doesn't let you know that it is not wireless, you have to plug it in for it to even power on. People says the Google chrome stick is better and I'm starting to think they were right.
author: Alejandra

review: The idea of it was nice and I liked that it had YouTube and could connect onto all the other movie streaming apps I am subscribed too but the reason I'm returning is that though it had good apps and variety its connected to wifi and sadly my wifi is not fast enough so there is a lot of lagging which can really suck when you are watching a movie and there is lag and its worst when you have anyone oh their devices using wifi. Anyways thought it through and still think it's good for those with good wifi but not for me. Oh well. Also I will mention that the smallness of the stick and the slick design of the remote is pretty cool so aesthetically its on point!
author: joshua and mimi "joshmimi"

review: I also own a ROKU Stick and compared the Fire TV Stick spends more time loading the videos. When using NBA Game Time the video recap of games played stops every few seconds to load more video. I didn't have this issue with the ROKU. There are also times when movies and tv shows are interrupted for the loading process.
